intro: Licania condoriensis, commonly known as the Condoriensis licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
